intro: Lochnera trichophylla, commonly known as the silky lochnera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid woodlands.
